com.ndi

Class TableFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ndi.TableFormat

  • public class TableFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to store the format of the text file that the tabular data was stored in such that the Validator can interpret the text file correctly.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  TableFormat.Format
      An static inner class represent individual column.

      TableFormat addEntryPattern(int index, java.lang.String entryPattern)

      TableFormat addFormat(java.lang.String[] format)
      Adding a list of string which represents how each column in the table is split.
      (package private) static TableFormat buildFromJSON(org.json.JSONObject input)
      Build a text file from JSON document.
      (package private) java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> parseColumns(java.lang.String input)
      Get a list of column and index mapping pairs from the first line of the text file Example: input = "col1 col2 col3 col4" returns {"col1" : 0, "col2" : 1, "col2" : 2, "col2" : 3}

      • patterns

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableFormat

        public TableFormat()

    • Method Detail

      • buildFromJSON

        static TableFormat buildFromJSON(org.json.JSONObject input)
        Build a text file from JSON document. This method does not perform JSON document input validation check. It is assumed that the validation is performed when EnumFormatValidator was constructed
        Parameters:
        input - an instance of JSONObject representing the fields of the Table Format class
        Returns:
        an instance of TableFormat
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when list of string representing how columns should be split is empty or when the size of the entryFormat list does not match with the number of column (1 more than the number of formatColumn)

      • addFormat

        public TableFormat addFormat(java.lang.String[] format)
        Adding a list of string which represents how each column in the table is split. This is meant to be called once. You can't add more format column on the top of the existing columns
        Parameters:
        format - a list of string represents how each columns is split For example: a$a#a*a is split by $, #,*, so format should be equals to ["$","#","*]
        Returns:
        an instance of TableFormat object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the size of format is less than 1, or addFormat has been called once

      • addEntryPattern

        public TableFormat addEntryPattern(int index,
                                   java.lang.String entryPattern)
        Add a pattern to a particular column of the table representing how the entry in that column is split
        Parameters:
        index - the (index)th column in the order of String[] format that was used when calling addFormat
        entryPattern - how the entry is split, for instance for a column with entry like "a, b, c, c", entryPattern should be equals to ", "
        Returns:
        a new instance of TableFormat with the pattern added

      • parseEntry

        java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> parseEntry(java.lang.String input,
                                               int index)
        parse an entry with multiple value split by a given pattern
        Parameters:
        input - the entries
        index - the column index in the order how the columns are added
        Returns:
        a string set of values in this entry
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method was called before addFormat has been called
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if index is out of bound (greater or equals to the number of columns)

      • parseLine

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parseLine(java.lang.String input)
        Split the line of text into an ArrayList of string, using the specified format specified by the user
        Parameters:
        input - the line of string we want to split
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of string being split using the given format. Null if the input is null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method was called before addFormat has been called

      • parseColumns

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> parseColumns(java.lang.String input)
        Get a list of column and index mapping pairs from the first line of the text file Example: input = "col1 col2 col3 col4" returns {"col1" : 0, "col2" : 1, "col2" : 2, "col2" : 3}
        Parameters:
        input - the first line of the text file (which usually consists of column name)
        Returns:
        a map of column name and its index, or null if input == null or there the entry
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method was called before addFormat has been called
